means: 大胆地，厚颜无耻地，大胆创新地

sentence.Network_en: They are raking in the profits from each more audaciously violent movie.
sentence.Network_cn: 通过一部部更加大胆的暴力电影，他们攫取了巨额利润。

sentence.Network_en: "What did you do?" asked Bethany audaciously.
sentence.Network_cn: “你做了什么？”贝萨妮大胆地问道。

sentence.Network_en: Discard your pudency, fondle me audaciously.
sentence.Network_cn: 丢弃你的羞怯, 大胆地爱抚我.

美国大学翻译中文38_书面语语_DuSystem... ... 无耐受力 aphoresis 无耻地 audaciously 无聊 bored.

list.abs: the most audacious move of the race so far is also , potentially , the most self-destructive .迄今为止，总统竞选中最为大胆的举动也可能是最具自我毁灭性质的。
Her audacious attitude helps her win the contest ., 她大胆的态度帮助她赢得了比赛.
Your plan of going abroad is an audacious decision ., 你计划出国是一项大胆的决定.
...the crowing of cocks and the barking of dogs鸡鸣犬吠monstrously audacious狗胆包天mere trash狗屁不通

entry.def: Someone who is audacious takes risks in order to achieve something.

example.ex: ...an audacious plan to win the presidency.
example.tran: 为当选总统而制订的大胆计划

sentences.sentence: "an idea so daring and yet so audaciously tempting that a shiver of excitement quivered through him"

auth_sentence.content: Audaciously scouting the Augustinian theory 'that the Blessed Virgin conceived our Lord through the Ears.'
auth_sentence.res_content: Audaciously scouting the Augustinian theory 'that the Blessed Virgin conceived our Lord through the Ears.'
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Audaciously scouting the Augustinian theory 'that the Blessed Virgin conceived our Lord through the Ears.'

auth_sentence.content: "Beyond life issues, an audaciously hope-filled Democrat like Obama is a Catholic natural," he wrote.
auth_sentence.res_content: "Beyond life issues, an audaciously hope-filled Democrat like Obama is a Catholic natural," he wrote.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Beyond life issues, an audaciously hope-filled Democrat like Obama is a Catholic natural," he wrote.

auth_sentence.content: Even more audaciously, Polanski declined to go to England, fearing extradition in his statutory-rape case.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even more audaciously, Polanski declined to go to England, fearing extradition in his statutory-rape case.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even more audaciously, Polanski declined to go to England, fearing extradition in his statutory-rape case.
